medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening abdominal pain with evidence of free air on CT scan.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior with worsening abdominal pain, becoming acute over the last day. Associated symptoms included severe abdominal pain, nausea, and one episode of emesis. The patient had elevated WBC (17.5) and lactate (2.6), with initial low blood pressure that improved with fluids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: CHF (systolic), CAD s/p DESx2 to LAD, NSTEMI, CABG x3, Degenerative Joint Disease, Depression, Anxiety, Fatty Liver, Gout, Hydronephrosis, CKD, Hyperlipidemia, HTN, Seasonal Allergies, Nephrolithiasis.
medical_history.family_history: Father - expired at age unspecified; Mother - expired at age unspecified.
